title: Hurricane Maria study warns: Future climate-driven storms may raze many tropical forests

title_detail.value: Hurricane Maria study warns: Future climate-driven storms may raze many tropical forests

summary: A new study shows that damage inflicted on trees in Puerto Rico by Hurricane Maria was unprecedented in modern times, and suggests that more frequent big storms whipped up by warming climate could permanently alter forests not only here, but across much of the Atlantic tropics.

summary_detail.value: A new study shows that damage inflicted on trees in Puerto Rico by Hurricane Maria was unprecedented in modern times, and suggests that more frequent big storms whipped up by warming climate could permanently alter forests not only here, but across much of the Atlantic tropics.
